title: Top 5 Strategies to Ensure Financial Health During Your Hospital Stay
subtitle: Discover five essential tips to help you navigate hospital costs and ensure financial wellness during your stay. Learn how to avoid unexpected charges and make informed decisions.
content:
Top 5 Ways to Make Sure You Stay Financially Healthy at the Hospital

Number 5: If you are offered a private room, make sure it's clear that you did not request that private room. Most insurance companies will charge an additional cost beyond your coverage. Consider getting a roommate – make a new friend!

Number 4: You'll most likely be asked to sign a document that states you will pay all costs, even if they're not covered by your insurance. Make it clear in writing that you will accept those charges as long as the services are provided by in-network providers.

Number 3: Make sure you know if you're being admitted to the hospital as inpatient or outpatient/observation status. These costs can keep you on observation status for up to three days, and these costs are typically much higher.

Number 2: If somebody visits your room or bed, ask who they are and why they're there. Take notes. If you're not well enough to do so, make sure you're with someone who is. These costs can add up quickly.

Finally, Number 1: Make sure you know what you’re being charged for any take-home equipment or supplies. You don’t want to wind up paying $1,000 for a bandage and a sling that you could have gotten at CVS for $10.

Stay healthy, TikTok.
